content:
All reagents and chemicals were purchased from commercial sources and used without further purification.

Synthesis of Coordination Compound <bold>1</bold>

The mixture of Zn(CH3COO)2·2H2O (82.3 mg, 0.375 mmol), benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylic acid (52.5 mg, 0.250 mmol), acridine (44.8 mg, 0.250 mmol) and distilled water (15.0 mL) was stirred at room temperature for 20 min and transferred to a Teflon-lined stainless autoclave (internal volume: 23.0 mL). The sealed autoclave was heated up at 165 °C under autogenous pressure for 3 days and then cooled to room temperature. Orange-red block-like crystals of 1 were collected in a total yield of 65.0 % based on Zn(CH3COO)2·2H2O source. The solid sample was washed by distilled water and isolated by filtration. PXRD pattern of 1 was shown in Fig. 1, from which it could be observed that the experimental pattern for the PXRD measurement match well with the simulated pattern.
clean_text:
Experimental

Chemicals and Reagents

All reagents and chemicals were purchased from commercial sources and used without further purification.

Synthesis of Coordination Compound 1

The mixture of Zn(CH3COO)2⋅2H2O (82.3 mg, 0.375 mmol), benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylic acid (52.5 mg, 0.250 mmol), acridine (44.8 mg, 0.250 mmol) and distilled water (15.0 mL) was stirred at room temperature for 20 min and transferred to a Teflon-lined stainless autoclave (internal volume: 23.0 mL). The sealed autoclave was heated up at 165 °C under autogenous pressure for 3 days and then cooled to room temperature. Orange-red block-like crystals of 1 were collected in a total yield of 65.0 % based on Zn(CH3COO)2⋅2H2O source. The solid sample was washed by distilled water and isolated by filtration. PXRD pattern of 1 was shown in Fig. 1, from which it could be observed that the experimental pattern for the PXRD measurement match well with the simulated pattern.
